title: Courses - IGERT Electronic Security and Privacy: Technological, Human, Enterprise, and Legal Considerations
contents: Search this site     Program Overview Sponsors FAQ People Faculty Staff Fellows Associates Alumni Research Publications Curriculum Courses Seminars Outreach International Partners Links And Resources Internships CyberCorps SFS Alumni HS-STEM Scholarships Apply           News ESP-IGERT Calendar Departments Contact Us Sitemap          Curriculum ‎ > ‎   Courses     Course Requirements  Supported by the different participating departments, the IGERT program offers a wide variety of courses selected from the pool of classes in those departments. The IGERT curriculum is tailored individually to every student, based on their research projects and interests. The curriculum includes topics in cybersecurity, communication, public policy, and information and decision sciences, and is decided upon acceptance to the program in coordination with the IGERT Fellows, their PhD advisors in their home department, and the IGERT Executive Committee. For more details about the curriculum offered at each department, consult the list Computer Science Courses Electrical Engineering Courses Communication Courses Information and Decision Sciences Courses Public Health Courses                       Sign in | Recent Site Activity | Report Abuse | Print Page | Powered By  Google Sites
